alert.note: Alert for Los Angeles (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 20 at 7:24PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by heavy rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest California, including eastern Los Angeles County. * WHEN...Until 1145 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas and water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 712 PM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated moderate to heavy rain and isolated thunderstorms across eastern Los Angeles County. Rainfall rates of 0.25 to 0.50 inches per hour were common, with local rates to 0.75 inches per hour, especially near thunderstorms. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen in the area, with local totals over 2 inches in the mountains. There has already been minor flooding in the advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.0 inch are expected in the area through late evening. This additional rain will result in widespread ponding of water on area roadwars and flooding of low lying areas and intersections. There may be some flooding of creeks and streams as well. Rocks and boulders may fall onto roadways, especially below steep terrain. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Long Beach, Lake Los Angeles, Acton, Wrightwood, Mount Wilson, Pasadena, Glendora, West Covina, Alhambra, San Dimas, Whittier, Pomona, Downtown Los Angeles, Palmdale, Lancaster, Rancho Palos Verdes, Altadena, Quartz Hill and Pearblossom. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
